etymology.description: 𠬜(𠬜) (ungkown, "unknown") + phonetic: 棥(棥) (unknown, "unknown") = phono-semantic composition -> 樊(樊) (fán, "enclosure")
etymology.interpretation: The character 樊(fán) combines an unknown semantic component and the phonetic component 棥(棥). Traditionally, it represents phonetic and semantic functionality together, symbolizing an enclosure or fence, although further clarification of 𠬜 is needed.

examples.chinese: 樊先生今天来访(樊先生今天來訪)，带来了珍贵的礼物(帶來了珍貴的禮物)。
examples.pinyin: Fán xiānshēng jīntiān lái fǎng, dài lái le zhēnguì de lǐwù.
examples.english: Mr. Fan visited today, and he brought precious gifts.
